confession.seduction_context: Approached her after her only son Gran Hans left for war with Mgr le Marquis and was reportedly defeated and drowned crossing a river. She wept for him for 3 years. Devil seduced her with promise she would see her son in 2 hours and would not want for anything.
sabbat_activities: ate two cows killed with drinks from masters
burned stillborn child keeping hands to use as candles
elected Scher Austien of Loudrefing as their king promising to pay him a florin every year

testimony.quarrel_subject: Catherine quarreled with Kyne Stoffel who said she had been called witch for more than 30 years
Catherine and Annon veuve Didier Vosgien (also arrested) had called one another witch

testimony.threat_quote: although he had much property, in 3 years he would have hardly any

testimony.quarrel_subject: 6 years earlier when he was tax collector, she complained he had overcharged her. He told her she had paid the same as other manouvriers
testimony.threat_quote: cursed him, wishing he might never return home in health
within 3 days 'il se donneroit de garde'

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: same time next day (within 3 days of threat)

testimony.quarrel_subject: 3 years ago had argument over payment for some grain he had bought from her to sow
testimony.threat_quote: She asked why wife cried for a horse, and she should beware lest she had something worse to lament

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: 10 years before during winter, dead in 6 weeks

harms_alleged.target: son Mengin (one side of face all burned)

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: a week later (after threat about having something worse to lament)

testimony.quarrel_subject: 3 years earlier had quarrel over payment between him and her husband, for whom he had done some work on ditches at Dieuze

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: soon after quarrel, bedridden for 6 months

timeline.subject: Catherine femme Adam Tarillon
timeline.details: 16 witnesses testified about reputation and alleged harms

timeline.subject: Catherine femme Adam Tarillon
timeline.details: Initial interrogation, she denied charges and provided natural explanations

timeline.subject: Catherine femme Adam Tarillon
timeline.details: No reproaches to any witness, but denied essential charges. Admitted various quarrels, attempts to heal, and less compromising remarks, also said she had a bastard child

timeline.subject: Catherine femme Adam Tarillon
timeline.details: Interrogation under torture - offered to confess as soon as she was prepared for torture

timeline.subject: Catherine femme Adam Tarillon
timeline.details: Said she could not take sacrament properly at Easter over last 5 years; spat out the host. Told of meeting where they elected Scher Austien of Loudrefing as king

timeline.subject: Catherine femme Adam Tarillon
timeline.details: Change de Nancy agrees, if she confirms her confessions under threat of torture

timeline.subject: Catherine femme Adam Tarillon
timeline.details: Final interrogation carried out as she was being prepared for execution, with confessions read out in public. Confronted with Annon, insisted she was a witch, but withdrew her other accusations

methods: moderate torture (preparation for torture was sufficient to induce confession)

accomplices_named.name: Barbe femme Schlosspetter
accomplices_named.context: Saw at sabbat/rosot to destroy acorns and kill animals

accomplices_named.name: Annon Vosgienne (veuve Didier Vosgien)
accomplices_named.context: Saw at sabbat/rosot, also arrested same day as Catherine. They had reportedly tried to smother Stoffel of Binstorff in his room at night 12 years earlier

accomplices_named.name: Clemence la Baste
accomplices_named.context: Saw at sabbat, found stillborn child in cemetery at Steinbach, opened stable door after entering through hole in form of caterpillar

accomplices_named.name: Evatte femme Rodtsix
accomplices_named.context: Saw at sabbat/rosot to destroy acorns

accomplices_named.name: Demel femme Welsch Anthoine
accomplices_named.context: Accompanied group that burned stillborn child at Bassing

accomplices_named.name: Scher Austien
accomplices_named.context: Elected as their king at night meeting, promising to pay him a florin every year (later withdrew this claim)

prior_accusations.context: Accused Catherine of showing her where a stillborn child was buried in cemetery at Bassing

notable_quotes.speaker: Catherine to Claudin Hamon
notable_quotes.french: que ses enffans ne seroient pas tous maire, ny les enffans d'un hardier tous hardiers, et qu'alors qu'il auroit payé le Sr Chastellain d'Albestroff qu'il auroit aussy peu qu'un aultre
notable_quotes.english: that his children would not all be mayor, nor the children of a hardier all hardiers, and that when he had paid the Sr Chastellain d'Albestroff he would have as little as another
notable_quotes.context: Defense response about threat to Claudin Hamon when he found her taking pears from a tree and called her witch

notable_quotes.speaker: Schlosspetter to Catherine
notable_quotes.context: Threat Catherine allegedly made to Schlosspetter about taxes, within 3 days horse had broken leg

notable_quotes.speaker: Rose femme Colas Tixerand (devineresse)
notable_quotes.french: qu'il y debvoit avoir bien ung cher eschellé de sorcieres en leur village
notable_quotes.english: that there must be quite a dear ladder/scale of witches in their village
notable_quotes.context: Comment to Claudin Haman about witches in Bassing when he consulted her as divineress

relationships.evidence_text: Catherine femme Adam Tarillon de Bassing
her only son Gran Hans had left for war with Mgr le Marquis
Rose femme Colas Tixerand, de Benestorff
Asked about illness of her son-in-law in her house
A year before his son Mengin became ill
their only daughter, aged 7, died miserably
she had always kept company with Annon Blomstein veuve Didier Vosgien; arrested same day; tried to persuade Annon to flee with her
quarrel over payment between him and her husband, for whom he had done some work on ditches at Dieuze
as neighbour at time she came to visit him

economic_context.details: Multiple disputes over money and payment: Tax dispute with Petter Boulengier when he was tax collector (she complained of overcharging); Payment dispute with Bernhard Humbert over work done for her husband on ditches at Dieuze; Argument with Noel Waultrin over payment for grain he bought from her to sow; Complaint to Schlosspetter over taxes. Catherine and Kyne Stoffel fought behind church calling each other witch and were forbidden from entering church by curé until they sought reparation. Witnesses noted significant economic losses (horses, cattle) attributed to her malefice, suggesting economic tensions in community.

harms_catalog.method_alleged: drink given to horses (according to devineresse la teinturiere de Bernestorff)

harms_catalog.harm_description: Frightened so much that he was out of his mind for a time
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: 12 years earlier when he had been at Bassing
harms_catalog.method_alleged: tried to smother him in his room at night

harms_catalog.harm_description: Fell ill and was in bed for 18 weeks
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Dispute over taxes - she complained he overcharged her, he said she paid same as other manouvriers, she cursed him
harms_catalog.method_alleged: curse/wish that he might never return home in health

harms_catalog.harm_description: Became very ill after drinking in house of la Vosgienne
harms_catalog.method_alleged: something put in his beer; Catherine brought him 'cerises confittes' saying they would make him better but he did not touch them

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Complained over taxes, she told him within 3 days 'il se donneroit de garde'

harms_catalog.harm_description: 7 horses dead in 6 weeks during winter
harms_catalog.method_alleged: witchcraft (according to monk at Niderhoff who told him it was the work of witches)

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: argument over payment for some grain he had bought from her to sow

harms_catalog.harm_description: One side of his face all burned
harms_catalog.method_alleged: visited him as neighbor, asked if he had seen anyone by his bed when he became ill

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Catherine asked wife why she cried for a horse (mare that died), and she should beware lest she had something worse to lament

harms_catalog.method_alleged: her daughter declared this was the only place where he had been (ill)

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: quarrel over payment between him and her husband, for whom he had done some work on ditches at Dieuze. She told him he would gain nothing
harms_catalog.method_alleged: threat/curse; she came to house several times during illness and asked his children, smiling, if their father had gone to the woods

material_culture.context: Claudin Hamon found Catherine taking pears from a tree
Catherine brought preserved cherries to ill Claudin Peletier, saying they would make him better, but he refused them suspecting poison
Claudin Peletier suspected illness came from something Catherine and la Vosgienne put in his beer when drinking at her house
Rose femme Colas Tixerand performed her divination ceremonies with a basin of holy water and a piece of silver
Used by devineresse Rose in her ceremonies to divine source of bewitchment
Claudin Hamon paid Rose the devineresse a bichot of wheat for her divination services
Noel Waultrin bought grain from Catherine to sow, argument over payment
Catherine tried unsuccessfully to cure Petter Boulengier with herbs
Used in confession - powder from stillborn child which la Baste found in cemetery at Steinbach, used in drinks to kill cows
Burned stillborn child at Bassing, keeping hands to use as candles

material_culture.object: apron with money (turned to dry leaves)
material_culture.context: Devil filled her apron with money when she reproached him for breaking promises, but it turned into dry leaves
Catherine said over last 5 years could not take sacrament properly at Easter; spat out the host, either in graveyard or into her handkerchief
Used to spit out the host after taking communion
Promised to pay Scher Austien of Loudrefing a florin every year when elected as their king

spatial_references.context: Primary location of trial, Catherine's residence, cemetery where stillborn child allegedly burned
Location where Anne vieille mairesse (who accused Catherine) was executed; home of Evatte femme Rodtsix
Mayor of Cutting acted as maire of 5 villages to make accord between Catherine and Kyne Stoffel; home of Demel femme Welsch Anthoine and Mathis Fiacre
Home of Rose femme Colas Tixerand the devineresse; Catherine's daughter came there 15 years earlier
Home of Stoffel (brother-in-law of Claudin Hamon) who was allegedly smothered in his room by Catherine and Annon 12 years earlier at Bassing
Location where Bernhard Humbert did work on ditches for Catherine's husband Adam Tarillon
Location of monk 'qui enseignoit beaucoup de choses cachées' consulted by Noel Waultrin about his animal losses
Cemetery where Clemence la Baste allegedly found stillborn child to make powder
Location of Sr Chastellain mentioned in Catherine's defense response to Claudin Hamon
Home of Scher Austien who was allegedly elected as their king at night meeting
Location of sabbat where they went to destroy acorns and eat cows
Catherine and Kyne Stoffel fought behind the church, calling one another witch; curé forbade them to enter church until they sought reparation
Where Anne alleged Catherine showed her where stillborn child was buried; where Catherine spat out the host
Where Catherine spat out the host after taking communion
Where Catherine's son Gran Hans's company was allegedly defeated and drowned after leaving for war with Mgr le Marquis

historical_context.military_details: Catherine's only son Gran Hans had left for war with Mgr le Marquis 6 years earlier. She later heard that his company had been defeated and drowned in crossing a river. She wept for him for 3 years before the devil allegedly approached her.
weather_events: failure of acorn crop attributed to sabbat activities - 'no acorns that year'
economic_hardship_indicators: Payment disputes over labor and grain
Significant livestock losses reported by multiple witnesses
Catherine seeking reparation for being called witch
Witnesses consulting diviners/healers rather than medical professionals
religious_calendar_references: Easter - Catherine could not take sacrament properly over last 5 years
Lent - Claudin Peletier became ill during previous Lent when drinking at la Vosgienne's house

prior_legal_disputes.description: Catherine quarreled with Kyne Stoffel who said she had been called witch for more than 30 years - Catherine sought reparation
prior_legal_disputes.outcome: Accord made by maire of Cutting as maire of 5 villages

prior_legal_disputes.description: Catherine and Kyne Stoffel fought behind the church, calling one another witch
prior_legal_disputes.outcome: Curé forbade them to enter church until they had sought reparation from one another

legal_context.redress_outcome: Accord made by maire of Cutting acting as maire of 5 villages in dispute with Kyne Stoffel; also ordered by curé to seek reparation after fight behind church

hearsay_chains.content: 12 years earlier Catherine and Annon Vosgien tried to smother him in his room at night
Catherine had given a drink to one of his sick horses
His animal losses were the work of witches
Catherine had given him his illness and had threatened him
Story about Catherine and Annon trying to smother Stoffel

emotional_state_notes: Initially denied charges saying they wronged her
Offered to confess as soon as she was prepared for torture (suggesting fear)
Withdrew accusations against accomplices at execution without explanation

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: No reproaches to any witness during confrontations on May 12, 1594

third_parties.name: Anne vieille mairesse
third_parties.context: Already executed at Bidestroff, had accused Catherine of showing her where a stillborn child was buried in cemetery at Bassing

third_parties.name: Annon Blomstein veuve Didier Vosgien
third_parties.context: Also arrested, Catherine tried to persuade her to flee together. Multiple witnesses mentioned they kept company together. Catherine insisted at execution that Annon was a witch but withdrew other accusations

third_parties.name: Kyne Stoffel
third_parties.context: Said Catherine had been called witch for more than 30 years, sought reparation through maire of Cutting; fought with Catherine behind church calling each other witch

third_parties.name: Stoffel of Binstorff
third_parties.context: Allegedly smothered in his room at night by Catherine and Annon 12 years earlier, frightened so much he was out of his mind for a time

third_parties.name: la teinturiere de Bernestorff
third_parties.context: Reckoned a devineresse, told Claudin Hamon that Catherine had given a drink to one of his sick horses

third_parties.name: monk at Niderhoff
third_parties.context: Said to teach many hidden things, told Noel Waultrin his animal losses were the work of witches

third_parties.name: Gran Hans
third_parties.context: Left for war with Mgr le Marquis 6 years earlier, his company was defeated and drowned crossing a river. Catherine wept for him for 3 years before devil approached her

third_parties.name: Mengin (son of Noel Waultrin)
third_parties.context: Became ill with one side of face all burned, visited by Catherine, recovered after being 'signé' by wife of Mathis Fiacre

third_parties.name: daughter of Noel Waultrin, aged 7
third_parties.context: Only daughter, died miserably a week after Catherine's threat to the wife about having something worse to lament

third_parties.name: wife of Mathis Fiacre
third_parties.context: Of Cutting, said prayer over Mengin and he recovered from his burned face

third_parties.name: Mathis Fiacre
third_parties.context: Of Cutting, his wife was a healer

third_parties.name: Barbe femme Schlosspetter
third_parties.context: Named in confession as accomplice at sabbat, helped kill cows with drinks from masters; accusation withdrawn at execution

third_parties.name: Clemence la Baste
third_parties.context: Named in confession as accomplice, found stillborn child in cemetery at Steinbach, opened stable door after entering through hole in form of caterpillar; accusation withdrawn at execution

third_parties.name: Evatte femme Rodtsix
third_parties.context: Of Biderstorff, named in confession as present at sabbat; accusation withdrawn at execution

third_parties.name: Demel femme Welsch Anthoine
third_parties.context: Of Cutting, named in confession as accompanying group that burned stillborn child at Bassing; accusation withdrawn at execution

third_parties.name: Scher Austien
third_parties.context: Of Loudrefing, allegedly elected as their king at night meeting, promising to pay him a florin every year; Catherine later withdrew this claim

third_parties.name: la moictresse at Bassing
third_parties.context: Intended victim in confession - Catherine said they intended to kill her cow, but she made sign of cross and they had no power

third_parties.name: Sr Chastellain d'Albestroff
third_parties.relationship_to_witness: mentioned in relation to Claudin Hamon
third_parties.context: Lord of Albestroff, mentioned in Catherine's defensive response about Claudin Hamon's payments

third_parties.name: Mgr le Marquis
third_parties.context: Military leader - Catherine's son Gran Hans left for war with him

third_parties.name: curé at Bassing
third_parties.context: Forbade Catherine and Kyne Stoffel to enter church until they sought reparation from one another after fighting behind church

third_parties.name: daughter of Rose femme Colas Tixerand
third_parties.context: Came to Benestorff 15 years earlier, married to Petter Boulengier (witness 7)

extraction_metadata.notes: Trial of Catherine Tarillon (also called Kratzkopf) from Bassing, 1594. Comprehensive extraction from 4-page PDF. Trial shows classic pattern: long-standing reputation (up to 30 years), multiple economic disputes and threats followed by harms, confession under threat of torture including sabbat attendance and accomplice naming, execution. Notable features: prior legal attempts to seek reparation for being called witch; consultation of multiple diviners/healers by victims; withdrawal of accomplice accusations at execution; emotional context of son's death in war preceding devil's seduction. Rich detail on material culture (food, magical objects, money) and economic tensions. 16 witnesses provided detailed testimony linking quarrels to specific harms with temporal sequences.
